definition: to mount (a horse, bike, flight of stairs, rickshaw etc)
to step across/to stride over/to straddle/to span
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]

sentences.english: Reaching the number, he hurried up the steps and did not spare the bell in waking the servant.
sentences.chinese: 到了公寓，他急忙跨上台阶，照旧按铃叫醒了女仆。

sentences.english: I put on my safety helmet and the glove, and sat on my silver-white colored bike.
sentences.chinese: 我带上安全帽和手套，帅气的跨上我的银白色铁马。

sentences.english: This time he got up from his chair and strode to the lectern confidently.
sentences.chinese: 这次他从座位上站起来，迈着大步很自信地跨上讲台。

sentences.english: He saddled his horse, mounted, and rode away at a gallop.
sentences.chinese: 套上鞍子，跨上马背疾驰而去。

sentences.english: Take my satchel without pen and paper, I write poetry for you in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 跨上书包，不带笔纸，我在心里，为你写诗。

sentences.english: She saw a man get on a horse and ride off .
sentences.chinese: 她看到一个男人跨上一匹马骑走了。

sentences.english: I saw a policeman get on a motorbike and ride off.
sentences.chinese: 我看见一个警察跨上一辆摩托车骑走了。

sentences.english: She takes a step forward and connects with a vicious right hook.
sentences.chinese: 她往前跨上一步，给了对方一个狠狠的右钩拳。

sentences.english: I had turned down the chewing tobacco, but I took the reins and mounted the horse.
sentences.chinese: 我前面拒绝了嚼烟叶，但这次我接过缰绳跨上了马背。

sentences.english: Step onto a paper towel or any surface that will leave an imprint of your foot.
sentences.chinese: 跨上一个擦手纸或任何表面会留下印记你的脚。

sentences.english: Many Dutch immediately hopped on to their bicycles to make their way home in silence.
sentences.chinese: 许多荷兰人马上跨上他们的自由车沉默地回家了。

sentences.english: The biker got back on his bike and rode off; just shaking his head.
sentences.chinese: 骑车人跨上他的自行车走了，不停地摇着他的头。

sentences.english: He swung himself into the saddle.
To get started, just put your left foot in the stirrup and swing your right foot over.
sentences.chinese: 开始的时候，把左脚放在马镫上，随后跨上右脚。

sentences.english: The top chords will be designed with a temporary bolted splice at mid-span.
sentences.chinese: 顶部弦杆将会被设计成中跨上临时螺栓的连接。

sentences.english: As soon as she passed the bars of the door, I lunged forward and slammed it shut.
sentences.chinese: 它刚爬过笼门，我就一步跨上前去把笼门关上了。

definition: in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
to whip on/to raise a whip/by ext. to swagger
horseback
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
large strides
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
quick step
to get on a horse/to mount
at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut
to stride forward
to speed along
to dash (run fast)/to rush/to dart
to leap/to spring/to throw oneself
stride/to step (on the spot)/to mark time/at a standstill
